title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2026-27 LIVE updates: FM Thennarasu to present interim Budget ahead of polls
content: State's Economic Survey 2025-26 said Tamil Nadu can achieve its trillion-dollar economy milestone by 2031 if it sustains the 2024-25 nominal growth rate of 16%

title: Bihar Congress conducts training for its observers amid delay in naming legislature party leader
content: Addressing the observers, Bihar Congress President Rajesh Ram said that the primary objective of the campaign is to strengthen the Congress Party’s organisation, and the selected members will be entrusted with greater responsibility and power

title: At least 175 people, mostly children, fall ill after consuming 'contaminated' food in Jharkhand
content: The food was allegedly consumed at a fair organised on Mahashivratri; most of the patients were suffering from vomiting, diarrhoea and abdominal pain

title: Maharashtra forms task force to address climate change and prevent farmers’ suicides
content: A 10-member panel comprising eight government officials and two experts held its first meeting on Monday

title: After HC order, Odisha government declares to catalogue jewelleries of Shree Jagannath Temple soon
content: The Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the counting and inventory prepared by the Shree Jagannath Temple Managing Committee is waiting for government’s approval

title: India's January trade deficit widens before U.S. tariff relief kicks in
content: A trade delegation will travel to Washington next week to finalise a trade agreement, Rajesh Agrawal, India’s ‌trade secretary

title: M.P. Assembly’s Budget Session begins with uproar over Indore deaths during Governor’s address
content: The day’s proceedings commenced with the singing of six stanzas of the national song Vande Matram in accordance with the Union Ministry of Home Affairs’ January 28 directive

title: ‘Advance of AI creating a governance responsibility’
content: Ajay Kumar Sood noted that more evidence is needed to understand how these tools impact a child’s development, mental health and education over time

title: Only Stalin can consolidate INDIA bloc to help Rahul become PM: Mani Shankar Aiyar
content: The Congress leader quotes Dr. Ambedkar to explain his estrangement from the Congress. “I am not a part of the whole; I am a part apart,” he says. He criticises Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, K.C. Venugopal and Pawan Khera.

title: With Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, Jammu and Kashmir plans to harness river waters
content: The J&K government has made a proposal to enable year-round navigation on the Wular lake by maintaining a minimum depth of water, which was not possible because of the Indus Waters Treaty

title: India’s federalism is in need of a structural reset
content: There is a need for balanced federalism in the form of autonomous States, an efficient Union, and accountable governance

title: Panel on Union-State relations submits initial report to CM
content: The report made out a case for decentralisation and State autonomy and outlined among other things issues relating to amendment of the Constitution;  territorial integrity of States, the Governor, and delimitation

title: Aequs Group to invest ₹4,000 crore; NMB-Minebea India Private Limited ₹1,980 crore in Tamil Nadu
content: Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa says the Aequs’ project would be India’s first fully vertically integrated aircraft engine manufacturing project

title: FEMA adjudicating authority imposes ₹184 crore penalty on NewsClick, founder Prabir Purkayastha
content: The adjudication proceedings were initiated on a complaint under Section 16 of FEMA filed by the ED alleging contraventions of FEMA and the rules and regulations pertaining to the receipt and utilisation of foreign funds

title: Municipal chiefs’ elections expose Congress-BJP power pact: Harish Rao
content: The former minister says Congress and BJP have shunned their ideologies for power in Telangana; he asks Congress whether joining hands with BJP is the change it promised

title: Security beefed up as courts in Uttar Pradesh receive bomb threat emails
content: The 18 districts which received the threats include Lucknow, Varanasi, Moradabad, Meerut, Ayodhya among others

title: Farmers in Villupuram, Puducherry call for early steps to repair Sornavur anicut across Thenpennai River
content: The anicut is a vital structure from where the water is diverted to the Bangaru Vaickal bringing water to several irrigation tanks in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry including the major tank of Bahour

title: SRIHER sets up centre of excellence for craniofacial care
content: The Centre offers advanced and holistic treatment for patients with cleft lip, cleft palate, and complex craniofacial conditions

title: Congress veteran Aiyar comes down on party’s State, national leadership
content: He says he will retract his prediction of a third term for CM Pinarayi Vijayan if the Congress endorses Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan as the UDF’s Chief Minister candidate. Aiyar also paints a grim picture of UDF’s electoral prospects

title: Isn’t checking infiltration your job, Assam party asks Amit Shah
content: The Barak Democratic Front has requested the Home Minister to publish a White Paper on the number of illegal infiltrators detected and expelled during the last 10 years of the BJP rule

title: Operational preparedness and integrated functioning among services vital, says Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh
content: Air Chief addresses the Annual Commanders’ Conference of the Southern Air Command in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Better for Congress to remain in  DMK-led front for its own sake, says CPI(M) State secretary
content: The Congress has raised the issue of power-sharing in Tamil Nadu at an inappropriate time, says P. Shanmugam. The CPI(M) will not take part in a coalition government, as its policy is not to be part of a government led by another party, he says

title: Congress says U.S. trade deal ‘mortgages’ farmer interests, energy security and digital autonomy
content: Congress leader and ex-Commerce Minister Anand Sharma claimed UPA govt. negotiated trade deals as ‘sovereign equals’, calls the interim trade agreement with the U.S. as a ‘sell-out’

title: Watch: AI Summit 2026: PM Modi inaugurates India AI Impact Expo
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on February 16, inaugurated the India AI Impact Summit 2026 at Bharat Mandapam in the national capital, underscoring India’s commitment to responsible and inclusive Artificial Intelligence.

title: Centre, BJP-ruled States ignoring injustice to gig workers: Rahul Gandhi
content: Class and caste-based discrimination are deeply embedded in the sector, and there is little accountability for companies, Congress leader says

title: Supreme Court allows Abu Salem to withdraw appeal on remission
content: Bench headed by Justice Vikram Nath leaves it open to convicted gangster Abu Salem to approach Bombay High Court for early listing of his pending case

title: 851 cases booked against erring auto drivers
content: Major violations detected during the drive included obstructive parking, charging excess fares, zebra crossing violations, jumping traffic signals and parking in undesignated zones

title: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu, Rabri Devi in land-for-jobs scam case
content: The CBI has alleged that no advertisements or public notices were issued for the appointments and the appointees sold or gifted land parcels to Lalu Prasad, his family members and a private firm

title: Two Pakistan nationals among three men escape observation home in Jammu: officials
content: The trio allegedly assaulted the guards on duty and managed to escape from the facility. One of the accused also brandished a pistol to threaten the staff of the observation home

title: KPCC leadership meeting says no second chances or cushioning posts for party candidates who lose the Assembly polls
content: According to party sources, AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal termed the polls as an existential battle; he said meritocracy would play a major role in candidate selection.

title: Global digital platforms must respect cultures and local laws, says Vaishnaw
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says there are no “physical boundaries” in the digital world, but acceptability keeps changing with societies; he says Indians are “digitally native” and adapt to new technologies easily

title: Full Cabinet and Ministers’ portfolio will be decided soon: Manipur Deputy CM
content: Deputy Chief Minister Losii Dikho says the rehabilitation of people displaced by the long violence in the State is a priority for the new government; on his colleague Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki-Zo leader, not being able to travel to Imphal, he says, ‘She is supporting us to reach out to the people’; the State government plans to hold a Cabinet meeting in Senapati, a Naga area, and go there via Kangpokpi, a Kuki-Zo area

title: Satheesan calls for revised affidavit on women’s entry to Sabarimala
content: Mr. Satheesan said that the government should notify the court that its earlier pro-women’s entry stance has shifted

title: High drama, clashes and postponements mark municipal chairman elections across Telangana
content: Authorities postponed elections in 11 civic bodies due to disputes, protests, lack of quorum, and allegations of political interference

title: Supreme Court to take a fresh look at pleas on ex post facto eco clearance regime
content: Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant schedules the case for hearing on February 25 and says the court will not tolerate any adjournments on that day

title: ‘Release Sonam Wangchuk,’ says farmer group in Maharashtra’s Miraj
content: Members of the Shetkari Sanghatana condemned the Union government’s decision to keep the environmental activist behind bars

title: UPSC given a week’s time to file affidavit on software for visually impaired candidates
content: The apex court had on December 3, 2025, directed the UPSC to incorporate a provision allowing eligible candidates to request a change of scribe till at least seven days before the test

title: Forest dept. set to introduce coracle rides at Panamkuzhy Ecotourism Centre
content: The initiative is expected to increase visitor footfall at the ecotourism centre and help generate additional revenue

title: Women to redefine urban leadership with Congress candidates being the maximum
content: Out of the seven municipal corporations that went to polls in the State, three mayoral posts were reserved for women, and significantly, all the women mayors belong to the Congress, underlining the party’s overwhelming dominance

title: A. Suresh likely to be UDF candidate in Malampuzha
content: The former personal assistant to V.S. Achuthanandan has reportedly been invited to join the front. Suresh says he has shared his views with UDF leaders and it is now up to them to decide. Govindan says CPI(M) will not reconsider decision to expel Suresh

title: Karnataka notifies 1% welfare fee to be collected from aggregators for social security of gig workers
content: While the Karnataka Platform-Based Gig Workers (Social Security and Welfare) Act, 2025 mandates a welfare fee of 1-5% of the payout for each transaction, the government has decided to stick to the lower end of the range, fixing 1% of every transaction for all the services

title: Two-year-old among three killed in separate road accidents
content: Angry passersby protested, demanding immediate repairs to the damaged roads, as well as measures to alleviate traffic congestion in that area

title: Madras High Court to hear former T.N. Minister Ponmudy’s petition against I-T assessment order after two weeks
content: Justice C. Saravanan directs the High Court Registry to list the case after two weeks since there had been a change in the counsel representing the I-T department

title: Death of student at coaching centre: parents seek justice
content: Parents Association of Andhra Pradesh seek the intervention of Education Minister and Commissioner of School Education in the matter

title: Campaign to address health concerns among migrant workers
content: As many as 15 HIV-positive cases were reported in and around Perumbavoor over the past few months; camp to be held on Feb. 22

title: Police plan awareness drive on K-Pop influence after minor girl’s death
content: District Police Chief (Ernakulam Rural) suggested the need for an awareness drive as a preventive measure in the wake of the Chottanikkara incident, as well as the recent death of three sisters in Ghaziabad who were allegedly obsessed with Korean culture

title: Defence personnel in uniform attend private event, spark row
content: The presence of defence personnel in uniform at the private awards ceremony attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh drew the ire of retired military personnel

title: Need to redirect Kerala’s health focus from mere mortality reduction to improving healthy life expectancy, financial protection, and quality of life, say experts at Vision 2031 meet
content: The State will have to redesign the health system to meet the new challenges of chronic disease, aging, and equity, they say

title: Srisailam celebrates Mahasivaratri Brahmostsavams with ‘Rathotsavam’, ‘Teppotsavam’
content: The chariot was adorned with 11 varieties of flowers such as marigold, chrysanthemum, roses and others; devotees pulled the chariot from the Gopuram to Nandi Circle and back

title: Transversal skills aid students in work, democratic participation: academic
content: University of Helsinki adjunct professor says development and transfer of competencies begin with teachers

title: Hill, cut by Fins, vows 'the Cheetah will be back'
content: The Dolphins released Tyreek Hill in a flurry of roster moves that will clear significant salary cap space.

title: USA's Meyers Taylor, 41, wins 1st Olympic gold
content: The United States' Elana Meyers Taylor won the women's monobob title Monday to win her first Olympic gold medal at age 41.

title: U.S. women's hockey to face Canada in final
content: The Americans continued their dominant run through the women's hockey tournament, routing Sweden 5-0 to reach the gold medal game vs. Canada.

title: Shooting at R.I. rink leaves 3 dead, teams fleeing
content: A shooting inside a Rhode Island hockey rink Monday left three people dead, several others injured and the two high school teams playing fleeing the ice as it all unfolded.

title: Judge: Frustrated by slow start to Yanks' winter
content: Aaron Judge said the start of the Yankees' offseason was "frustrating" but believes the team is in a better spot now.

title: Browns' Hickman assaulted at New York hotel
content: Browns safety Ronnie Hickman was assaulted in the lobby of a New York City hotel early Monday morning, the team said.

title: French hockey player who fought Wilson banned
content: France's Pierre Crinon, who fought Canada's Tom Wilson at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, was suspended Monday by the French ice hockey federation.

title: Own goal ends dream FA Cup run for Macclesfield
content: Macclesfield were unable to recreate the magic of last month's FA Cup win over Crystal Palace, with a Sam Heathcote own goal sending Brentford through to the fifth round after a spirited contest at Moss Rose.

title: The ultimate debate: Skubal or Skenes? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 starting pitchers in MLB
content: We break down the best players at every spot on the diamond entering 2026, starting with a star-studded position featuring two of baseball's biggest stars.

title: The crushing weight of Olympic pressure -- and how athletes can prepare for it
content: Even "unbeatable" athletes such as Ilia Malinin feel overwhelmed in the Olympic spotlight. How can they combat it? Experts weigh in.

title: The 11 trades we want to see this NFL offseason: Barnwell finds new homes for 15 players
content: DJ Moore and A.J. Brown to the AFC West? Kyler Murray in a new offense? Rams going all-in again? And a new WR1 for the Bills? Let's build 11 win-win deals.

title: Why did the Dolphins release Tyreek Hill now, and what's next for him?
content: Miami cut ties with the receiver, but questions remain for the franchise and Tyreek Hill. Here's what we know.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Michigan is the new No. 1
content: After nine straight weeks at the top, the Wildcats fall after back-to-back losses, making way for the Wolverines.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke into top 10, Georgia and Minnesota debut
content: The top five stayed the same, Duke entered the top 10, and Maryland and TCU were the biggest climbers.

title: What we learned at NBA All-Star Weekend
content: NBA All-Star Weekend delivered -- on and off the court. Let's unpack everything we saw (and heard) in Los Angeles.

title: Macclesfield FC's cup magic ends with an own goal, but with their legacy secure
content: A second FA Cup shock always seemed unrealistic for tiny Macclesfield, but Monday's home defeat to Brentford does little to shake their legacy in this storied competition.

title: How we can improve the Champions League: New mini-league? Clubs picking opponents?
content: Mark Ogden, Gab Marcotti and Bill Connelly offer their best ideas for how to solve the Champions League's woes.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: LaMelo to DeMar: Which L.A. NBA stars would've made an All-Star roster in high school?
content: From LaMelo Ball to James Harden, these Los Angeles NBA stars' high school résumés would land them on an All-Star roster.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: College football had an incredible season. Remember how we got here
content: The sport's manifest destiny opened doors for Indiana and others. Consolidating power and access could eliminate the thrill of that growth.

title: Inter-Juve ruined by one of the worst refereeing decisions; Liverpool turn a corner?
content: The big game of the Serie A weekend was ruined by a big refereeing error; what matters now is making sure it doesn't happen again. Plus: Liverpool show more signs of recovery, and Vini Jr. steps up for Real Madrid.

title: Is soccer better without VAR? FA Cup shows nobody really knows
content: Neither the third or fourth rounds of the FA Cup used VAR, yet they produced opposite reactions on whether soccer needs the technology.

title: No more Rivalry Week? Explaining MLS' new schedule format for 2026
content: The new MLS season for 2026 is about to begin, and with it comes changes to the league's schedule. So what exactly is the plan?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Tottenham eye Bayern's Kim
content: Chelsea and Tottenham are reportedly looking to sign Kim Min-jae from Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Macron India visit: PM Modi to host French prez in Mumbai today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosts French President Emmanuel Macron in Mumbai. The leaders will enhance defence, trade, and technology cooperation. Several agreements are expected. The India-France Year of Innovation begins. Discussions will cover regional and global issues. AI cooperation is also a key focus.

title: ‘Nothing to hide’: Trump responds to Epstein link claims; takes dig at Hillary Clinton
content: President Trump reiterated his denial of any involvement with Jeffrey Epstein, stating he has been "totally exonerated" and has "nothing to hide." He claimed investigations cleared him and suggested Epstein opposed his election. Released files reference past contact and Trump's comments to investigators, though officials found no credible information warranting further investigation into him.

title: Classmate 'mistreated' Indore MBA student's body after killing her, performed occult ritualls
content: A 24-year-old MBA student was found murdered in her classmate's rented house in Indore. The accused, who was in a close relationship with the victim, allegedly strangled her after suspecting her of talking to other men. He later fled and was apprehended in Mumbai, where he reportedly performed occult rituals while on the run.

title: The Godfather fame actor Robert Duvall passes away at 95
content: Veteran Hollywood star Robert Duvall, known for his iconic performances in The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95. His death on Sunday was confirmed by his wife, Luciana Duvall, on Monday.

title: Pete Hegseth reportedly angry with Anthropic, Pentagon 'close' to cut business ties
content: The Pentagon is reportedly furious with AI firm Anthropic, considering cutting business ties and labeling it a "supply chain risk." This severe designation, usually for foreign adversaries, would force companies to sever ties with Anthropic to work with the US military. Tensions escalated over AI usage terms and Anthropic's CEO's public concerns.

title: Why Zimbabwe and Ireland is a make-or-break clash in the T20 World Cup
content: Zimbabwe and Ireland's upcoming T20 World Cup match is crucial, potentially deciding Australia's fate. Sri Lanka has already qualified. Zimbabwe, with two wins, faces Ireland, who are still mathematically alive. A Zimbabwe victory sends them through and eliminates Australia. An Ireland win opens the door for Australia, but they'll need a strong performance and favorable net run rate.

title: 'Drop them': Shahid Afridi slams son-in-law Shaheen Shah Afridi, Babar Azam after 61-run defeat
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has called for the exclusion of senior players like Babar Azam, Shadab Khan, and Shaheen Shah Afridi following their T20 World Cup loss to India. Afridi urged the management to try fresh faces against Namibia, stating the current seniors haven't delivered consistent results despite ample opportunities.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: KPMG puts thousands of dollars fine on partner for using AI to pass AI test
content: A KPMG Australia partner faced a $7,000 fine for using AI to cheat on an internal AI training course. This incident highlights a broader issue, with over two dozen staff caught using AI for exams.  The firm is strengthening its AI detection, as similar cheating scandals plague the accounting industry, prompting concerns about governance and integrity.

title: 'Pawan Verma making false allegations': Ameesha Patel speaks on cheque bounce case
content: Ameesha Patel has broken her silence after a Moradabad court issued a non-bailable warrant against her in connection with a 2017 event dispute. Taking to her Instagram Stories, Ameesha addressed the reports and termed the case an old, settled matter.

title: Food, faith, and fight: Afghanistan’s pressure playbook at the T20 World Cup
content: Far from home comforts and craving Afghan food, Afghanistan’s cricketers are learning to cope with emotional and on-field pressure. A team dinner of Peshawari food helped them process the heartbreak of a double Super Over loss against South Africa, while growing resilience in crunch moments powered them over the line vs UAE, keeping their slim T20 World Cup Super Eight hopes alive.

title: Elon Musk replies to trillionaire post, says have little cash
content: Elon Musk clarified that his substantial net worth is primarily derived from his ownership stakes in Tesla and SpaceX, with less than 0.1% held as cash. He emphasized that the value increase benefits Tesla and SpaceX employees, as well as over 80% of Tesla's retail and institutional investors.

title: All 3 convicts get death in Hampi rape-murder case
content: In a landmark ruling, a Karnataka court has sentenced three individuals to death for the heinous gang rape of an Israeli tourist alongside an Indian woman, as well as the murder of a man from Odisha last year. The presiding judge classified the crime as the 'rarest of rare,' affirming that the prosecution presented irrefutable evidence of their guilt.

title: Addi Smith, mother Tawnia McGeehan die in suspected murder-suicide
content: Tawnia McGeehan and her daughter, Addi Smith, were found dead inside a Las Vegas hotel room after missing a cheer competition. Police believe the Utah mother shot her child before taking her own life. A note was discovered, and the investigation continues. Utah Xtreme Cheer shared an emotional tribute, calling the loss heartbreaking for the entire community.

title: Cardi B confirms breakup with Stefon Diggs while defending him on tour
content: Rapper Cardi B confirmed her breakup with NFL player Stefon Diggs during a concert. She publicly defended Diggs against rapper BIA's online remarks. This happened after Diggs's Super Bowl performance. Cardi B stated Diggs remains family despite their split. The couple had unfollowed each other on social media earlier. Speculation about cheating allegations also surfaced.

title: Alix Earle shares cryptic note as Tom Brady focuses on family
content: Tom Brady, the NFL legend, has dominated headlines over the last few years after he divorced his ex wife and continued to be linked to high profile women. Amid all the rumors, his latest romance has been speculated to be 25 year old influencer Alix Earle. Now, Alix Earle has shared a cryptic post as Tom Brady enjoys with his family in Switzerland.

title: O Romeo sees major drop, crosses Rs 51 crore globally
content: In the world of cinema, Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri's latest venture, 'O' Romeo,' sparked a range of reactions upon its release. While audiences applauded the actors' performances, the plot left many wanting more. Following a steep decline on its first Monday, the film brought in Rs 4.75 crore, with total domestic earnings now at an impressive Rs 34 crore.

title: 30 minutes, 20km: SUV at 100kmph kills 3, leaves 2 critical in UP
content: A speeding SUV caused a deadly rampage across a 20km stretch in Badaun, UP, on Sunday evening. The vehicle, reportedly traveling at nearly 100kmph, struck at least three motorcycles, resulting in three fatalities and two critical injuries. Witnesses described scenes of panic as the driver fled after each collision. Police are reviewing CCTV footage to apprehend the suspect.

title: Cash in circulation rises 11% to record Rs 40 lakh crore
content: Currency in circulation hit a record Rs 40 lakh crore, yet its share in the economy declined to 11.2% as digital payments surged. Despite increased absolute cash holdings, driven by tax enforcement and low interest rates, UPI transactions now dominate everyday economic activity, indicating cash's growing role as a store of value.

title: Amid Kuki-Naga clash, 51 kids 'rescued' from Manipur school
content: Fifty-one Kuki students were safely evacuated from Manipur's Ukhrul district to JNV Kangpokpi due to escalating Kuki-Naga tensions. The relocation, prompted by security concerns, ensured the safety of students, including 18 board examinees. Authorities prioritized student well-being amidst heightened regional unrest.

title: Set ablaze by hubby, MP woman walks 4km to police, seeks no FIR for kids' sake
content: In a harrowing tale of survival, a woman from Chhatarpur endured a brutal attack at the hands of her husband, who allegedly beat, strangled, and set her ablaze. Against all odds, she sought refuge in a haystack overnight and managed to escape. The following morning, she courageously trekked nearly 4 kilometers to the police station, ready to tell her story.

title: Kwality Wall's eyes bigger scoop of ice cream market after HUL demerger
content: Kwality Wall's India is expanding its ice cream market reach, aiming to position it as an everyday snack. The company, recently demerged from HUL and listed on the BSE, is leveraging factors like quick commerce and increased refrigerator penetration. The Magnum Ice Cream Company is set to become its new majority shareholder following an open offer.

title: Cong disassociates, but Aiyar says unlike Rahul friends, he is with party
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar hit back at the Congress after the party dissociated itself from his prediction of a Left victory in Kerala. Aiyar asserted his continued loyalty to the party, questioning why anyone would remain if not for belief in the Nehru-Gandhi family's leadership.

title: Post Op Sindoor, Attari loses its charm; footfall almost halves
content: The Attari-Wagah border ceremony has seen a significant drop in visitor numbers, nearly halving after Operation Sindoor. Changes implemented post-operation, including the removal of the customary handshake and restricted gate openings, have altered the visitor experience. While footfall has improved since the ceremony's resumption, it has not yet returned to pre-operation levels.

title: Siddaramaiah camp to take 27 MLAs abroad 'to counter DKS push for CLP meeting'
content: A foreign tour by Congress legislators aligned with CM Siddaramaiah has intensified a power struggle with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar over a rumored leadership transition.  While legislators claim the trip is routine, insiders view it as a tactic to counter Shivakumar's push for a CLP meeting to discuss a change in leadership.

title: Maha CM Fadnavis stays minority tags issued hours after Ajit Pawar's death
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has stayed minority status certificates for at least 75 educational institutes following allegations of irregularities. The decision came after opposition members demanded an inquiry into how these certificates were issued so quickly after the death of then-deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

title: TN Cong seeks action against party MP Manickam Tagore for putting DMK ties under 'strain'
content: Tamil Nadu Congress chief K Selvaperunthagai met Mallikarjun Kharge in Bengaluru, submitting a report on recent discord with DMK. The friction arose from MP B Manickam Tagore's remarks on power-sharing and alleged disrespect from DMK leaders. Selvaperunthagai urged action against Tagore, warning of potential alliance strain, and cautioned party members against public statements on alliance issues.

title: India moves to stop Ravi waters to Pak as Shahpur Kandi dam nears finish
content: India is set to redirect surplus Ravi river water, previously flowing into Pakistan, to its own drought-prone regions once the Shahpur Kandi dam becomes operational. This significant move, expected by March 31, will irrigate vast areas in Punjab and Jammu & Kashmir, marking a strategic shift in water resource management following a policy change regarding the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: 'He bailed the team out': Gavaskar reveals turning point of India vs Pakistan clash
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised Suryakumar Yadav's astute match awareness following India's dominant T20 World Cup win over Pakistan. Gavaskar highlighted Suryakumar's crucial innings against both the USA and Pakistan, emphasizing his ability to anchor the batting and stabilize the innings under pressure. This strategic approach proved vital in securing India's victory and a Super 8 spot.

title: From 'chaiwala' to 'Rahulian': Aiyar returns with a roar; Cong ducks for cover, again
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar has once again embarrassed the Congress with his remarks, first praising Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and then dismissing the party's leadership, including spokesperson Pawan Khera. The Congress has distanced itself from Aiyar, stating he has no connection with the party. This incident follows a pattern of Aiyar's controversial statements that have previously aided the BJP.

title: Nissanka ton powers Sri Lanka into Super 8; Australia on brink of elimination
content: Pathum Nissanka's unbeaten century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket victory over Australia, securing their Super Eight spot in the T20 World Cup. Nissanka's brilliant 100 not out off 52 balls anchored the chase after Australia posted 181. Australia now faces elimination if Zimbabwe defeats Ireland.

title: The weight-loss shot everyone wants: Who should actually be taking Mounjaro and Wegovy?
content: Weight loss injections, once for diabetes, are now trending as beauty hacks. Experts warn these prescription drugs, like Mounjaro and Wegovy, are for medically supervised obesity management, not cosmetic use. They're for individuals with a high BMI or related health issues who haven't succeeded with lifestyle changes. Careful doctor consultation is crucial, as certain medical histories preclude their use.

title: Kurt Van Dyke slain in Costa Rica; girlfriend survives attack
content: American hotel owner Kurt Van Dyke was killed during a robbery at an apartment in Cahuita, Costa Rica. Police say armed suspects tied up his girlfriend, stole valuables, and fled in stolen vehicles. Reports from The Tico Times and Surfer.com confirmed key details. Van Dyke, linked to a historic California surfing family, had lived in Costa Rica for years.

title: Maduro's gone — But is Venezuela witnessing a new 'Don'?
content: Venezuela is in a new political phase after President Nicolas Maduro's removal. Delcy Rodriguez now leads an interim administration. Diplomatic ties with Washington are restoring. The oil sector is opening to private operators. Hundreds of detainees have been released. However, the security apparatus remains. Elections are not yet announced. Key figures of the old establishment continue in power.

title: From Moran to Mach 2.8: Inside IAF's night-ready war machines
content: India has opened a new emergency landing strip in Assam. This facility is part of a larger plan to create multiple air bases across the country. The move enhances India's air power and survivability. It signals a strategic shift in defense doctrine. This development strengthens India's readiness for modern warfare scenarios.

title: Ameesha Patel faces non-bailable warrant in Rs 4.5 lakh cheque case
content: Legal trouble has resurfaced for Ameesha Patel as a Moradabad court issued a non-bailable warrant against her in connection with a 2017 event dispute. The order came after the actress allegedly failed to appear despite multiple summons issued by the court.

title: Ireland Opens Probe Into Elon Musk's Grok AI Over Sexualised Images
content: Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC) said on Tuesday it had opened a formal investigation into X's AI chatbot Grok over the processing of personal data and its potential to produce harmful sexualised images and video, including of children.

title: Indian-Origin Man Jailed In Singapore For Posing As Prison Officer
content: An Indian-origin man was sentenced to nine months' imprisonment by a Singapore court after he pleaded guilty to pretending to be a prison officer in an email sent to President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and the Secretariat of the Singapore Parliament.

title: Indo-US Defence Ties Continues To Grow Stronger: US Ambassador Sergio Gor
content: US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Admiral Samuel J Paparo visited the Indian Army's Western Command headquarters on Monday and held discussions with Lieutenant General Manoj Kumar Katiyar on strategic security dynamics along India's Western Front.

title: 3 Killed, Including Suspect, In Shooting At Rhode Island Hockey Rink In US
content: Police are responding to reports of multiple people hurt in a shooting at a Rhode Island ice rink where a youth hockey game was scheduled.

title: Zelensky Warns Of New Russian Strikes Ahead Of Geneva Peace Talks
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday that Ukrainian intelligence showed more Russian attacks on energy targets lay ahead and that such strikes made it more difficult to reach an agreement on ending the nearly four-year wari

title: Congress Launches 'Talent Hunt' To Select Spokespersons In Madhya Pradesh
content: After the "Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan", the Congress in Madhya Pradesh has now announced the launch of a "Talent Hunt Programme" to recruit a new batch of party spokespersons.

title: UP Kargil War Veteran Kills Wife, Son; Then Dies By Suicide: Cops
content: A 51-year-old retired army personnel, who was a Kargil war veteran, allegedly shot his wife and 16-year-old son dead at their home here in Sen Pashchim Para, before dying by suicide on a nearby railway track, police said on Monday.

title: Punjab Government Under Attack Over Top Cops' Presence In Anti-Drug Rally
content: The Opposition parties in Punjab have raised multiple questions regarding the government's anti-drug rally and have objected to the presence of government officials on the occasion.

title: PM Modi, C Naidu Playing Key Role In India's Digital Revolution: Bill Gates
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates on Monday said India was ahead in the digital revolution and credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu with playing a key role in it.

title: 'Bhupen Borah Is Our Asset, I Apologise If Any Wrong Was Done': Gaurav Gogoi
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Monday praised Assam Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) chief Bhupen Kumar Borah, calling him a "strong Congress leader" and an "asset" to the party amid ongoing internal discussions within the state unit.

title: PM Modi Explores Artificial Intelligence Exhibits At India AI Expo 2026
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday explored multiple exhibition pavilions, engaging with startups, researchers, and technology leaders showcasing AI applications across sectors at the India AI Impact Expo 2026.

title: Himachal Governor Cuts  Assembly Speech To 2 Minutes, Row Erupts
content: The Budget Session of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly began on a stormy note, with sharp differences surfacing between Governor Shiv Pratap Shukla and the state government over the contentious issue of Revenue Deficit Grant or RDG.

title: Video: 3, Including 2 Pakistanis, Shoot Their Way Out Of J&K Observation Home
content: A major security lapse has left the Jammu and Kashmir Police scrambling after three inmates, including two Pakistani nationals, staged a violent escape from an Observation Home in RS Pura on Monday evening.

title: 'He Screamed For Help For 10 Minutes': Mother Of Delhi Man Killed In Crash
content: The mother of the 23-year-old who died in a recent car crash where a minor was at the wheels, said there are multiple challans on the car.

title: Tarique Rahman To Take Oath As Bangladesh's Prime Minister Today
content: Tarique Rahman will take the oath as the new Prime Minister of Bangladesh on Tuesday after leading his party to a forceful victory in the crucial general elections.

title: Teen Gets Bail Week After SUV Ran Over 23-Year-Old In Delhi
content: Delhi Scorpio Crash - During the investigation, the driver of the Scorpio was caught. Police said that the teenager was driving without a valid driving licence at the time of the accident.

title: US Ambassador Sergio Gor Visits Indian Army's Western Command Headquarters
content: US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Admiral Samuel J Paparo, Commander of the US Indo-Pacific Command, on Monday visited the Indian Army's Western Command headquarters and held discussions with Lt Gen Manoj Kumar Katiyar.

title: Arvind Kejriwal To Face Assembly Panel On March 6 In Faansi Ghar Row
content: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal set to appear before the Privileges Committee of the Delhi Legislative Assembly on March 6 in the ongoing "Faansi Ghar" controversy.

title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards Corps Begin Military Drills In Strait Of Hormuz
content: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps on Monday began a series of military exercises in the Strait of Hormuz, state media reported, on the eve of talks with the United States.

title: In its war against Reds, CRPF is now wiping out Maoist 'memorials'
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: J&K: Three inmates, including Pak duo, flee Jammu juvenile home after injuring 2 cops
content:
The assault was captured on CCTV camera

JAMMU: Three inmates of a juvenile observation home, including two Pakistani nationals, fled custody after allegedly attacking and injuring two policemen posted on guard duty at the facility in RS Pura area in Jammu district on Monday evening. After escaping the observation home around 5.15pm, the trio allegedly robbed a bike at gunpoint and left RS Pura, said sources. Police launched a massive hunt to trace the fugitives. Special security points were set up en route to Samba district and in Jammu, said sources, claiming that the accused might leave for Samba to reach the national highway and exit the region. The injured cops, SPO Vinay Kumar and Head Constable Parveen Kumar, were hospitalised.

End of Article
